newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks add to gains, Dow up 1.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks add to gains, Dow up 1.4 pct.

text.p: U.S. stocks drove higher in late trading, pushing the Dow into record territory.
Traders said short covering, combined with an absense of selling pressure as many players left for the holiday weekend, created a bullish environment for stocks.
"The stock market is easily pushed up when a lot of people are on the sidelines," said Peter Coolidge, senior equity trader at Brean Murray and Co.
The Dow was up 95 points, or 1.3 percent, at 7353 after pushing up over 100 points. It was trading above its record closing high of 7333.55 set May 15.
